cells.data: This is a basic **HTML5** template snippet. The **%|** symbol tells TextExpander to move the cursor to that point. When used with the **qt:exptext** Alfred command, Alfred will process the **Handlebars** expansion and pass it to **TextExpander** to insert in the document and handle any of it's particular macros.

<!doctype html>

<html lang="en">
<head>
  <meta charset="utf-8">

  <title>{{projectName}}</title>
  <meta name="description" content="{{content}}">
  <meta name="author" content="{{author}}">

  <link rel="stylesheet" href="css/styles.css">

  <!--[if lt IE 9]>
  <script src="http://html5shiv.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/html5.js"></script>
  <![endif]-->
</head>

<body>
   %|
  <script src="js/scripts.js"></script>
</body>
</html>
The next cell contains the **json** data set for assigning the title in the template.

This template is a basic **HTML5** template with the title set in the **json** data structure. You can have your data in the templates as well in the **Defaults** note. Data defined in the templage area, like the above data, it will override the same definition in the **Defaults** data structure.
